definition: incitement to subvert state power (criminal charge used to gag free speech)
pinyin: shan1 dong4 dian1 fu4 guo2 jia1 zheng4 quan2

sentences.english: Khomeini’s regime responded with remarkable brutality, slaughtering thousands of the organization’s members.
sentences.chinese: 霍梅尼政权残忍的镇压游行，屠杀了几千名组织成员。

sentences.english: We think we're all ready to implement universal suffrage in 2012.
sentences.chinese: 我们认为到2012年应有全面的民主参政权。

sentences.english: Most Zainichi remove themselves from the North Korean regime as much as they can.
sentences.chinese: 大部分在日朝鲜人使自己离朝鲜政权越远越好。

sentences.english: The heart of the Aztecs' power was an economic unity.
sentences.chinese: 阿芝科特政权的核心是一个经济统一体。

sentences.english: What we are witnessing might in the end be on a par with the swift and sudden collapse of the communist dictatorships of Eastern Europe.
sentences.chinese: 而最后等待我们的是政权的迅速瓦解，其状必如东欧。

sentences.english: Sino-Japanese War period, the County is the coexistence of two regimes.
sentences.chinese: 抗日战争时期，县境基本上是两种政权并存。

sentences.english: Necklacing was also used to punish members of the black community who were perceived as collaborators with the apartheid regime.
sentences.chinese: 也用在黑人团体中和种族隔离政权勾结的成员身上。

sentences.english: Yuan Shikai forced emperor to abdicate and hand over power to him.
sentences.chinese: 袁世凯逼迫皇帝逊位，把政权交给了他。

sentences.english: Could Kim Jong Il's regime really be brought undone by K-pop and South Korean soap operas?
sentences.chinese: 金正日政权真的有可能被韩国音乐和肥皂剧推翻吗？

sentences.english: The South Korean puppet regime must return my daughter to her mother's arms right away.
sentences.chinese: 韩国傀儡政权必须马上送还我的女儿到母亲的怀抱。

sentences.english: Many Iraqis said they were happy that Saddam Hussein's rule was over.
sentences.chinese: 许多伊拉克人说他们很高兴撒达姆，候赛因政权结束。

sentences.english: The effort to privatize state-owned enterprises turned into an enrichment scheme for cronies of the regime.
sentences.chinese: 而国企私有化则成了政权姻亲的致富模式。

sentences.english: The people should be persuaded to become accustomed to observing the decrees of the anti-Japanese democratic government.
sentences.chinese: 在人民中，要养成遵守抗日民主政权法令的习惯。

sentences.english: Coruscant continued as the capital of the galaxy under this new regime.
sentences.chinese: 在这个新政权的统治下，科洛桑依然是银河系的首都。

sentences.english: The Huang Taiji Period was the important stage that the Qing Dynasty political power turned from armed administration to literary administration.
sentences.chinese: 皇太极时期是清朝政权由武治向文治转变的重要阶段。

sentences.english: Bohai regime of Tang Dynasty had a frequent intercourse with Japan.
sentences.chinese: 唐代渤海政权与日本隔海相望，往来频繁。

definition: to found a country/nation-building/the foundation of PRC by Mao Zedong in 1949
to set up an independent regime/to secede/segmentation/division/fragmentation
to recover one's power or authority/restoration (of a past regime)
to come to power/to hold power/in office
